definitions: standard unit or system used to express the size, amount, or degree of something
action or process of finding the size, quantity, or degree of something using instruments or methods
proposed law or course of action officially submitted for approval or consideration
group of beats in music marked off by vertical lines on a musical staff
examples: The meter is the standard measure of length in the metric system
They used imperial measures to calculate the room's dimensions
The measure of the fabric took several minutes to complete
Precise measure of temperature requires calibrated instruments
Congress debated the new tax measure for three weeks
The security measure was implemented immediately after the incident
Each measure contains four beats in this waltz composition
The pianist counted measures before beginning her solo

definitions: process or action of finding and recording the size, amount, or degree of something using standard units
specific dimension, size, or amount determined by measuring something
examples: The measurement of ocean depth requires sophisticated sonar equipment
Accurate measurement of ingredients ensures consistent recipe results
Her waist measurement was thirty inches exactly
The carpenter recorded all measurements in his notebook

definitions: ongoing action or practice of determining size, amount, or degree using instruments or standards
examples: The measuring of rainfall helps predict drought conditions
Careful measuring ensures the furniture will fit through the doorway

definitions: flesh of an animal used as food for human consumption
essential or most important part of something; the substance
examples: The butcher displayed fresh meat in the refrigerated case
She doesn't eat meat for environmental and ethical reasons
The meat of the argument appeared in the third paragraph
Let's get to the meat of the matter without delay

definitions: industrial business of slaughtering animals and processing their meat for distribution and sale
examples: The meatpacking plant employed thousands of workers from the region
Meatpacking regulations ensure food safety throughout the supply chain

definitions: holy city in Saudi Arabia that is the spiritual center of Islam and destination for pilgrimage
place that attracts many people with a particular interest or activity
examples: Millions of Muslims travel to Mecca for the annual hajj pilgrimage
The direction of Mecca determines the orientation for daily prayers
Silicon Valley became a mecca for technology entrepreneurs worldwide
Nashville is a mecca for aspiring country music performers

definitions: skilled worker who repairs and maintains machinery, especially motor vehicles
fundamental principle or method by which something works or is operated
examples: The mechanic diagnosed the engine problem within ten minutes
She trained as an aircraft mechanic at the technical college
Understanding the mechanics of the stock market requires careful study
The mechanics of cell division fascinate biology students

definitions: process of changing from manual labor to machine-based production methods in industry or agriculture
examples: The mechanisation of farming dramatically increased crop yields
Factory mechanisation reduced the need for manual workers

definitions: system of parts working together in a machine; a piece of machinery
natural or established process by which something takes place or is brought about
examples: The clock's mechanism needed careful oiling and adjustment
A complex mechanism controls the automatic transmission
The mechanism of photosynthesis converts sunlight into chemical energy
They established a mechanism for resolving workplace disputes

definitions: process of introducing machines to replace human or animal labor in production or operations
examples: The mechanization of textile production sparked the Industrial Revolution
Agricultural mechanization transformed farming practices in developing countries

definitions: metal disc with an inscription or design, given as an award for achievement or commemoration
examples: She won a gold medal in the Olympic swimming competition
The soldier received a medal for bravery in combat

definitions: person who has won a medal, especially in sports competition
examples: The Olympic medalist signed autographs for young athletes
Several medalists attended the championship anniversary celebration

definitions: large medal worn as decoration or commemorative item, often on a chain
circular decorative element used in architecture, textiles, or design
small round cut of meat, especially tender beef or veal
examples: The medallion around his neck bore the family crest
She inherited her grandmother's antique medallion
The ceiling featured ornate medallions surrounding each chandelier
Persian rugs often display intricate medallion patterns
The chef prepared veal medallions with mushroom sauce
Pork medallions cook quickly due to their small size

definitions: person who has been awarded a medal for achievement, particularly in sports
examples: The gold medallist set a new world record
Former medallists coached the junior swimming team

definitions: act of interfering in matters that are not one's concern, especially in an annoying way
examples: Her constant meddling in office politics created tension
The committee resented government meddling in local affairs

definitions: emergency evacuation of injured or sick people by helicopter or aircraft to medical facilities
examples: The medevac helicopter arrived within minutes of the accident
Military medevac operations saved countless lives during the conflict

definitions: middle value in a set of numbers arranged in order; the statistical midpoint
strip of land or barrier separating opposite lanes of traffic on a divided highway
examples: The median income for the neighborhood was sixty thousand dollars
In this dataset, the median provides a better measure than the mean
The truck crashed through the median into oncoming traffic
They planted trees in the highway median

definitions: intervention in a dispute to help parties reach an agreement through negotiation and compromise
examples: The mediation between management and union lasted three days
They chose mediation instead of going to court

definitions: person who attempts to help parties in conflict reach an agreement by facilitating communication
examples: The mediator helped the divorced couple agree on custody arrangements
An experienced mediator resolved the labor dispute

definitions: medical practitioner or student; person trained to give emergency medical treatment
examples: The combat medic treated wounded soldiers on the battlefield
Medics arrived at the accident scene within minutes

definitions: comprehensive physical examination to assess a person's health status and fitness
examples: She passed the medical required for her pilot's license
Annual medicals help detect health problems early

definitions: substance used to treat disease or relieve symptoms; pharmaceutical drug prescribed or administered
examples: The doctor adjusted her medication to reduce side effects
He takes medication daily to control his blood pressure

definitions: science and practice of diagnosing, treating, and preventing disease and maintaining health
substance or preparation used for treating disease or maintaining health
examples: She studied medicine at Harvard Medical School
Modern medicine has dramatically increased life expectancy
Take this medicine three times daily after meals
Traditional Chinese medicine uses herbs and acupuncture

definitions: informal term for a medical practitioner or doctor, especially in military contexts
examples: The old medico had treated three generations of families
Army medicos worked tirelessly during the emergency

definitions: city in Saudi Arabia that is the second holiest site in Islam after Mecca
old walled part of a North African city, typically containing markets and residences
examples: The Prophet's Mosque in Medina attracts millions of pilgrims annually
Medina holds special significance in Islamic history
The medina of Marrakech is a UNESCO World Heritage site
Tourists explored the narrow streets of the ancient medina

definitions: state or quality of being average or unremarkable; lack of exceptional quality
person of average or below average ability or achievement
examples: The restaurant's mediocrity disappointed the food critics
She refused to accept mediocrity in her work
The company replaced several mediocrities with talented professionals
History forgets mediocrities but remembers exceptional individuals

definitions: practice of focused attention and awareness to achieve mental clarity and emotional calm
deep thought or contemplation about a particular subject or theme
examples: Daily meditation reduced her stress and improved concentration
The monastery offered meditation retreats for beginners
His book includes meditations on mortality and meaning
The essay was a meditation on urban loneliness

definitions: middle position, degree, or size between extremes; average or moderate
means or channel through which something is communicated or expressed
material or technique used by an artist to create work
person claiming to communicate with spirits of the dead
examples: She ordered a medium coffee with extra cream
The medium temperature setting worked perfectly
Television became the dominant medium for news delivery
Social media is a powerful medium for marketing
Oil paint was her preferred medium for portraits
The sculptor worked in the medium of bronze
The medium claimed to contact their deceased grandmother
Police consulted a medium about the missing person

definitions: piece of music combining several different songs or tunes played continuously
varied mixture or collection of different things
examples: The band performed a medley of Beatles hits
The swimming medley includes four different strokes
Dinner featured a medley of roasted vegetables
The book is a medley of essays and short stories

definitions: snake-haired female monster in Greek mythology whose gaze turned people to stone
free-swimming sexual form of a jellyfish or other cnidarian
examples: Perseus defeated Medusa by using his shield as a mirror
The Medusa myth symbolizes the danger of female rage
The medusa stage follows the polyp stage in jellyfish development
Scientists studied the medusa form under microscopes

definitions: small burrowing mongoose native to southern Africa that lives in groups and stands upright
examples: Meerkats take turns standing guard while others forage
The zoo's meerkat exhibit attracted crowds of children

definitions: organized gathering for athletic competition, especially track and field or swimming events
examples: She broke two records at the regional track meet
The swim meet attracted competitors from fifty schools

definitions: assembly of people for discussion, decision-making, or other shared purpose
occasion when people come together, either planned or by chance
examples: The board meeting lasted three hours
Staff meetings occur every Monday morning
Their first meeting was at a coffee shop
The chance meeting changed both their lives

definitions: building used for public assembly, especially for religious worship in some Protestant denominations
examples: The Quaker meetinghouse dates from colonial times
Town discussions were held at the old meetinghouse

definitions: informal abbreviation for megabyte, a unit of computer memory or data storage
examples: The file is only two megs in size
This old computer has just sixteen megs of RAM

definitions: unit of computer information equal to one million bytes or 1,024 kilobytes
examples: The photo file was three megabytes in size
Email attachments are limited to twenty megabytes

definitions: unit of frequency equal to one million hertz, used especially for radio waves and computer processors
examples: The processor runs at two thousand megahertz
Radio stations broadcast at specific megahertz frequencies

definitions: cone-shaped device used to amplify and direct the voice over distance
examples: The protest leader used a megaphone to address the crowd
Lifeguards keep megaphones for emergency announcements

definitions: unit of explosive force equivalent to one million tons of TNT, used for nuclear weapons
examples: The nuclear bomb had a yield of fifty megatons
Scientists calculated the asteroid impact in megatons

definitions: unit of electrical power equal to one million watts or one thousand kilowatts
examples: The wind farm generates thirty megawatts of electricity
Peak consumption reached two hundred megawatts

definitions: hard thermosetting plastic material used in laminates, adhesives, and dishware manufacturing
examples: Melamine plates are popular for outdoor dining
The contaminated milk contained dangerous levels of melamine

definitions: profound sadness and depression characterized by persistent low mood and loss of interest
examples: Victorian literature often depicted melancholia as a romantic affliction
His melancholia deepened during the winter months

definitions: person who tends toward sadness, depression, or thoughtful reflection on sorrowful themes
examples: The melancholic artist created hauntingly beautiful paintings
As a melancholic, he found comfort in somber poetry

definitions: feeling of thoughtful sadness, typically with no obvious cause; gentle depression
examples: Autumn always brought a sense of melancholy to her mood
The melancholy of the empty house overwhelmed him

definitions: mixture or medley of various things; a diverse blend or combination
examples: The restaurant offered a melange of Asian and European cuisines
Her writing style was a melange of different influences

definitions: dark biological pigment in skin, hair, and eyes that provides color and UV protection
examples: Melanin production increases with sun exposure
People with more melanin have better natural sun protection

definitions: serious form of skin cancer arising from pigment-producing cells called melanocytes
examples: Early detection of melanoma greatly improves survival rates
The dermatologist removed a suspicious melanoma from his shoulder

definitions: hormone produced by the pineal gland that regulates sleep-wake cycles
examples: Melatonin supplements help some people overcome jet lag
The body naturally produces melatonin when darkness falls

definitions: combination or blend of different elements merged into a unified whole
examples: The dish was a perfect meld of sweet and savory flavors
Their music represents a meld of jazz and classical styles

definitions: confused struggle or skirmish involving many people; chaotic close combat
examples: A melee erupted when the referee made a controversial call
Several people were injured in the melee outside the stadium
